quest.name: Divine Nonintervention
journal: Something appears to weigh upon Deryk's mind.

Having finished visiting your destinations, Deryk expresses his concern for Krile on account of her earlier exchange with G'raha Tia. It is decided that you will check on her, to which end you first make your way to Gridania.

In Gridania, Menphina and Halone waste no time sensing Nophica and Byregot, but curiously note that the two are in different locations. Observing that Nophica is close by, Halone dashes off to find her sister goddess, and you hurry after her.

Halone leads you true, and you locate Nophica in the altar of her namesake. When pressed as to why she isn't with the others, the Matron explains that Krile wished to complete her task without divine supervision. Byregot still follows her discreetly, however, and so you decide to rendezvous with the Builder, who is near Camp Tranquil in the South Shroud.
Byregot informs you that Krile now makes her way to Althyk's stone. In order to hasten your passage, he summons a pair of Rhalgr's hawks to bear you and Deryk.

You and Deryk take to the air in search of Krile, and find her already at the stone. There, she reveals that it was the desire to seek the answers in her own way and prove herself capable that prompted her to send the gods away. Your concerns thus laid to rest, Krile then turns to the task of extracting information, and bids you await her in Quarrymill.

Speaking with Deryk in Quarrymill, you learn how he feels about involving himself in the lives of others. Though he believes it wrong to interfere, it seems he can't help but extend a helping hand when it comes to it.

dialogue.name: HALONE
dialogue.text: Among us Twelve, Menphina is the most approachable to mortalkind. 'Tis one of her positive traits.

dialogue.name: MENPHINA
dialogue.text: Suffice it to say we love you too, Forename!

dialogue.name: BABYOPOOPO
dialogue.text: Ook...?

dialogue.name: DERYK
dialogue.text: With this, we have completed our task and may return to the Omphalos...

dialogue.name: DERYK
dialogue.text: Yet I can't help but think about Krile.

dialogue.name: DERYK
dialogue.text: G'raha Tia seemed to be worried about her, did he not? 'Twas as if something weighed on her mind. Though she is in the company of deities, I find myself worrying too.

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Whatever it is, there's only one way to find out!

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: You could ask her directly.

dialogue.name: DERYK
dialogue.text: Yes, I suppose so...

dialogue.name: DERYK
dialogue.text: So you didn't notice anything amiss? Perhaps I simply imagined it, but I worry nonetheless.

dialogue.name: DERYK
dialogue.text: If there are no objections, let us seek out Krile.

dialogue.name: MENPHINA
dialogue.text: She has headed to the Twelveswood with Nophica and Byregot, yes?

dialogue.name: MENPHINA
dialogue.text: They are presently too far away for us to sense, but we should be able to locate them once in the forest.

dialogue.name: DERYK
dialogue.text: I see. In that case, let us make for Gridania.

dialogue.name: HALONE
dialogue.text: As I understand it, mortals hold that Nophica and I are at odds. Like other details about us, you are free to believe what you wish.

dialogue.name: MENPHINA
dialogue.text: For all his preference for solitude, Deryk certainly seems concerned for the welfare of others. How very intriguing...

dialogue.name: BABYOPOOPO
dialogue.text: Ook!

dialogue.name: DERYK
dialogue.text: So, here we are in Gridania. Can you sense Nophica and Byregot?

dialogue.name: MENPHINA
dialogue.text: I do...but something is strange.

dialogue.name: HALONE
dialogue.text: Indeed. They appear to be in different places.

dialogue.name: HALONE
dialogue.text: Nophica is the nearer of the two, and is quite close by. I shall go and find her.

dialogue.name: DERYK
dialogue.text: Wait! You mustn't go off on your own!

dialogue.name: DERYK
dialogue.text: Ugh, confound it all! After her, Forename!

dialogue.name: DERYK
dialogue.text: I'd thank you not to do that again...

dialogue.name: MENPHINA
dialogue.text: Both Nophica and Halone are very good to me. 'Tis our way to look out for one another.

dialogue.name: BABYOPOOPO
dialogue.text: Ook...

dialogue.name: NOPHICA
dialogue.text: Oh? Have you already finished visiting your stones?

dialogue.name: HALONE
dialogue.text: There she is.

dialogue.name: NOPHICA
dialogue.text: Well now, I wasn't expecting to see you all here... Is aught the matter?

dialogue.name: DERYK
dialogue.text: You're supposed to be with Krile and Byregot. Where are they?

dialogue.name: NOPHICA
dialogue.text: Oh, we became separated while I was distracted, listening to the elementals.

dialogue.name: NOPHICA
dialogue.text: The beings are the voice of those who call the wood home. As I'm the patron of this land, they could not help but report to me.

dialogue.name: DERYK
dialogue.text: You gods can sense each other. Even should you become separated, shouldn't it be a simple matter to find them again?

dialogue.name: HALONE
dialogue.text: Indeed. 'Twould seem you are keeping something from us, Nophica.

dialogue.name: NOPHICA
dialogue.text: Oh, Halone, there is simply no fooling you. Very well, I shall confess all.

dialogue.name: NOPHICA
dialogue.text: The child Krile wanted to visit our stones alone, you see. To complete her task without us watching over her.

dialogue.name: NOPHICA
dialogue.text: We merely respected that wish.

dialogue.name: NOPHICA
dialogue.text: With her abilities, I do not believe she is in any danger. But the worrier that he is, Byregot decided to follow after her discreetly.

dialogue.name: MENPHINA
dialogue.text: If this is her wish, then indeed, we must abide by it.

dialogue.name: NOPHICA
dialogue.text: As for Byregot... Ah, yes. I sense him in the place men call the South Shroud.

dialogue.name: DERYK
dialogue.text: One of the stones is situated there, I believe near Camp Tranquil. Let us search that area for Byregotâ”€if we find him, we should find Krile as well.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You scour the undergrowth, but see no signs of Byregot. It must have simply been the wind.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You search the broken barrel, but find no god disguised as an adorable critter.

dialogue.name: BYREGOT
dialogue.text: ...What brings you all here?

dialogue.name: DERYK
dialogue.text: We understand you've been following Krile. Where is she?

dialogue.name: BYREGOT
dialogue.text: Having acquired information from my stone, she now makes for Althyk's.

dialogue.name: BYREGOT
dialogue.text: I keep my distance to avoid being seen, and was about to continue on when you appeared.

dialogue.name: NOPHICA
dialogue.text: Althyk's stone is her last destination, is it not? Let us all go and meet her there.

dialogue.name: BYREGOT
dialogue.text: If everyone so wishes, then very well.

dialogue.name: BYREGOT
dialogue.text: To hasten our passage, I shall call upon Master Rhalgr's servants to bear the mortals.

dialogue.name: DERYK
dialogue.text: It seems we have the use of these hawks. Let's see if we can spot Krile from above.

dialogue.name: DERYK
dialogue.text: I will bring our companions, so you needn't worry about them. Are you ready, Forename?

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Mount the hawk and search for Krile?

dialogue.name: DERYK
dialogue.text: Go, my feathered friend. Fly like the wind.

dialogue.name: DERYK
dialogue.text: I must thank you, Forename. Talking to you helped me to find the resolve to seek out Krile.

dialogue.name: DERYK
dialogue.text: No signs of her here... Let's continue on to Althyk's stone.

dialogue.name: DERYK
dialogue.text: There she is already. She certainly wasted no time.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: Well, now... Did you come all this way just to check on me?

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: I've been on edge, worrying that I might stumble into Odin, so you gave me a bit of a fright.

dialogue.name: DERYK
dialogue.text: Nophica tells us that you wished to travel alone. What prompted you to send the gods away?

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: Hmmm... It's difficult to explain.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: I suppose... I suppose I wanted to seek the answers in my own way.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: As the gods told us, if we wish to know the truth, we must discover it for ourselves.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: In spite of this, they've seen fit to not only set us upon the right path, but accompany us besides.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: This bespeaks the faith that they have in man's spirit of inquiry. And it gives me heart.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: After all, 'tis the selfsame spirit that defines the Students of Baldesion.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: Like everyone, I want to uncover the truth of the Twelve. To know their aspirations and understand them.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: And having seen a dear friend embark on countless adventures, I've developed the desire to see and experience the world for myself.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: There are dangers out there, of course, but I wanted to prove that I could handle them and perform my task.

dialogue.name: DERYK
dialogue.text: ...I see. Indeed, as much as we can learn from others, there's no substitute for seeing with one's own eyes.

dialogue.name: DERYK
dialogue.text: And in yours, I see the gleam of yearning for exploration and discovery. It reveals to me the love you bear for our star...and it makes me glad.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: Wh-What's this all of a sudden? It's embarrassing when you say such things with a straight face...

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: Right, then. I've yet to acquire the information here, so I'll tend to it at once. Perhaps you'd like to wait for me at Quarrymill?

dialogue.name: HALONE
dialogue.text: In this land, those voices raised in praise for Nophica are especially strong.

dialogue.name: MENPHINA
dialogue.text: Nophica and Byregot are also kind, are they not?

dialogue.name: BABYOPOOPO
dialogue.text: Ook, ook!

dialogue.name: DERYK
dialogue.text: Let's wait for Krile here. Nophica and Byregot are with her, so she will be fine.

dialogue.name: DERYK
dialogue.text: <sigh> First the man at Menphina's mark, and now Krile... In the course of traveling with you and yours, it seems I inevitably end up encroaching upon others' lives.

dialogue.name: BABYOPOOPO
dialogue.text: Ook! Ook, ook!

dialogue.name: DERYK
dialogue.text: Aye, yours as well... Though nothing binds you to me, you've followed me ever since I tended your wounds. You're free to go anywhere, you know.

dialogue.name: DERYK
dialogue.text: A person's life belongs to that person alone. Others can't be expected to assume responsibility for it, and thus is it wrong to interfere.

dialogue.name: DERYK
dialogue.text: Alas, once I've glimpsed someone's heart, I find I can't avert my gaze. It truly is difficult to be amidst people...
